intro: Dipterocarpus crinitus, commonly known as the hairy dipterocarp, is a tropical tree native to Southeast Asia. It is characterized by its large, leathery leaves that are often covered in fine hairs, giving it its common name. The plant produces small, yellowish flowers that are typically clustered in inflorescences. Its fruit is a woody capsule that splits open to release seeds. This species plays an important ecological role in its native habitats, contributing to forest biodiversity and soil stability.
